title: Failed to load SAM menus
content:
When you access the SAM page, the system fails to load the menu items.

Possible causes

  • Cause 1: Some failed tenants are in the available tenant list for end users. That is, the tenant status is displayed as active, but actually the tenant is unavailable for access for reasons such as deployment failure or upgrade failure.
    Follow these steps to decide the cause:
    1. Go to the Network tab in Developer tools from your browser.
    2. Check if you can see the https://${samHost}/sam/smax/rest/${tenantId}/personalization/person/me/tenant API with an error response.
  • Cause 2: The LWSSO cookie domain has been changed. However, the expired old domain token is still stored by the browser and sent to the back end of your system.

Follow these steps to decide the cause:

  1. Go to the Network tab in Developer tools from your browser.
  2. Filter the requests by “/sam/smax” and see if all the response statuses are 401. In this case, other responses of SAM APIs should be fine.

Solution

Solution for cause 1

  1. Check if there are any tenants to which you can't log in.
  2. Set these tenants unavailable to end users. You can inactivate or delete them, or you can change them to private and remove all the users attached to them.

Solution for cause 2

Clear the browser cache, or open Developer tools >Application >Cookies to delete all the cookies under the old domain.
